result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Mykle J. McMahon, in custody, appeared with Attorney Peter J. Morin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  3:35 pm  and 14CF345

All parties have rec'd PSI.  No corrections requested.  Defendant is prepared to proceed today.

Joint recommendation:   w/held sentence
5 yrs. probation, 6 mo jail w/credit for 125 served
Sex offender evaluation, counseling, and testing
AODA and follow through
No unsupervised contact w/minors
no alcohol consumption or possession, no bars or taverns
$268 fine  and $250 DNA surcharge

Defendant makes statement to court

Court:  sentences defendant as follows:  30 years prison imposed & stayed.

15 confinement, 15 years supervision
Cond:  1 yr co. jail, credit for time served - 352 days.  Huber allowed
Undergo all evals and assessments required by PO - to include Sex eval, AODA, and follow through
No contact with any victim.  No unsupervised contact w/minor females
STD testing to be shared with victims, 
Register with Sex Offender
Pay $268 cc and $250 DNA surcharge
Cannot vote for 15 years.  Cannot own a firearm.
State has 60 days to submit restitution request

COURT goes through determinate sentence.
Judege granted extension for time on PSI- 03/30/15
may be addressed at the sentencing so left on calendar - perhaps may have to change sent. date on the DRI -

Defendant waives rights, pleads  NO CONTEST   to Ct. 1 - 14CF97
COURT:  finds waiver voluntary, finds defendant guilty - COUNT 1 - 14CF97   PSI ORDERED
Dismiss Ct. 2 and 14CF345 - to be read in at time of sentencing  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
